title: Questor: If Neil Woodford had stuck to income investing he might still have a business
text:
Questor Income Portfolio: it was income that his investors wanted – his mistake was to offer a hybrid fund that targeted capital gains from dividend-less stocks

We will conclude this week’s focus on events at Neil Woodford’s funds with a look at what lessons there are for income investors in particular. Mr Woodford, after all, made his name as an income fund manager.

In Wednesday’s column we argued that readers’ key task when scrutinising funds was to check that there was a consistent and clearly articulated process.

Mr Woodford’s main fund, Equity Income, was in effect a hybrid. Some of its holdings were traditional income stocks, much like those he had held in portfolios he had previously...
